author: D8H
description:
An action which, when applied on some objects, snap these objects to a *virtual grid*, with cells having customizable width and height.

Useful for level editors or putting objects on a tiled based map (RPG, strategy games, or any tiled based game in general).
name: HexagonalGrid
shortDescription: Action to snap objects to a virtual hexagonal grid during the game.

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual pointy topped hexagonal grid (this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual pointy topped hexagonal grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToPointyToppedHexagonalGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual pointy topped hexagonal grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: The actual row height will be 3/4 of this.
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: Odd rows are shifted from half a cell, use a "CellHeight * 3/4" offset to make it the other way.
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual bubble grid (this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual bubble grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToBubbleGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual bubble grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment:
This grid is like bottles stacking, odd lines are shifted from half a cell. 

On an hexagonal grid a line height is 3/4 of sprite height but with bubbles it is sin(60°) that is around 0.866 which is near 7/8 = 0.875
(7/6)/(3/4) = 7/6
Using this ratio, the cellHeigt gives the 7/8 line height and this allows integer position as assets are often a multiple of 8.
